name: TradeOfferHelper
description: A World Interaction helper that represents a single trade offer from a merchant entity (villager, wandering trader, etc.).
overview:
The `TradeOfferHelper` class is a World Interaction helper in JSMacros that represents a single trade offer from a merchant entity (villager, wandering trader, etc.). It provides detailed information about trade requirements, pricing adjustments, usage limits, and economic factors that affect the trade's availability and cost.

This class is particularly useful for creating scripts that:
- Analyze individual trade opportunities
- Monitor price changes and market dynamics
- Create automated trading decision systems
- Track merchant reputation and demand mechanics
- Calculate trade profitability and value

methods.name: getInput
methods.description: Returns a list of all input items required for this trade. This includes both the primary input item and any secondary input item (for 2-for-1 trades). Empty slots are automatically filtered out.

methods.name: getLeftInput
methods.description: Returns the primary (left) input item required for this trade. This uses the adjusted price with any demand bonuses or discounts applied. (Since 1.8.4)

methods.name: getRightInput
methods.description: Returns the secondary (right) input item required for this trade. If this is a simple 1-for-1 trade, this will return an empty ItemStack. (Since 1.8.4)

methods.name: getOutput
methods.description: Returns the item that will be received when this trade is successfully executed.

methods.name: getIndex
methods.description: Returns the index position of this trade in the merchant's trade list. This is useful for selecting trades programmatically. (Since 1.8.4)

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects this trade offer in the merchant trading interface. This method will only work if the villager inventory screen is currently open and the trade index is valid. Returns `this` for chaining.

methods.name: isAvailable
methods.description: Returns `true` if this trade is currently available, `false` if it's disabled or locked. Trades become unavailable when max usage is reached or stock runs out.

methods.name: getNBT
methods.description: Returns the complete NBT data for this trade offer as a compound tag. This includes all trade properties, pricing data, and merchant-specific information.

methods.name: getUses
methods.description: Returns the number of times this trade has been used. When this reaches `getMaxUses()`, the trade becomes disabled until the merchant restocks.

methods.name: getMaxUses
methods.description: Returns the maximum number of times this trade can be used before it becomes disabled. This value varies by trade type and merchant characteristics.

methods.name: shouldRewardPlayerExperience
methods.description: Returns `true` if this trade will award experience points to the player upon successful completion. (Since 1.8.4)

methods.name: getExperience
methods.description: Returns the amount of experience points awarded when this trade is successfully completed.

methods.name: getCurrentPriceAdjustment
methods.description: Returns the current price adjustment compared to the original price. Positive values indicate price increases (high demand), negative values indicate discounts.

methods.name: getOriginalFirstInput
methods.description: Returns the original (unadjusted) primary input item before any price modifications due to demand, reputation, or special effects. (Since 1.8.4)

methods.name: getOriginalPrice
methods.description: Returns the original price (stack count) of the primary input item without any adjustments. (Since 1.8.4)

methods.name: getAdjustedPrice
methods.description: Returns the current adjusted price (stack count) of the primary input item after all modifications (demand, special price, reputation) are applied. (Since 1.8.4)
examples:
const adjustedPrice = trade.getAdjustedPrice();
Chat.log(`Current adjusted price: ${adjustedPrice}`);

methods.name: getSpecialPrice
methods.description: Returns the special price multiplier affecting pricing based on reputation. Negative values indicate discounts, positive values indicate premiums. (Since 1.8.4)

methods.name: getPriceMultiplier
methods.description: Returns the price multiplier for this trade type, determining how much prices fluctuate due to demand. (Since 1.8.4)
examples:
const priceMultiplier = trade.getPriceMultiplier();
Chat.log(`Price multiplier: ${priceMultiplier}`);

methods.name: getDemandBonus
methods.description: Returns the demand bonus applied to this trade. Demand increases when players frequently trade the same items. (Since 1.8.4)

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of this trade offer, including input and output items.
examples:
const tradeString = trade.toString();
Chat.log(`Trade info: ${tradeString}`);
